alert.note: Alert for Stewart; Sumter; Webster (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 6:52PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Stewart, Webster and southwestern Sumter Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 652 PM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Westville to near Croxton Crossroads, and moving southwest at 30 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Americus, Lumpkin, Preston, Richland, Plains, Weston, Kimbrough, Westville, Croxton Crossroads, Leveretts, Troutman, Centerpoint, and Dumas. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
